result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Lee Meyer

defendant.name: Meyer, Robert Lee
defendant.address: 403 1/2 W Evans Street, Rice Lake, WI 54868

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
clerked by RWinger
Defendant Robert Lee Meyer in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Robert Lee Meyer in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM126, 15CM103,15CT50,14TR1948 and 14TR1949
State relates agreement. Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the Court. 

15CM126: Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 

Court relates and orders:  
15 days jail with Huber - credit for 12 days 
Costs.  

15CM103: State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants and orders the case be dismissed and read-in. 

15CT50: Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 (OWI). Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Attorney Raymond relates no successful collateral attacks. 
State moves to dismiss Count 2. Court grants dismissal.   

Court relates and orders: 
$1,505.00 fine inclusive of costs, but plus DNA surcharge. 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
20 days jail with Huber - consecutive to 15CM126 
16 month IID
16 month DL revocation. 
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. (.412 BAC) 

14TR1948 and 14TR1949: State moves to dismiss. Court grants dismissal. 

JAIL FAXED.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Must undergo daily PBTs at the Rice Lake Police Department at 6:00 PM.

Defendant Robert Lee Meyer in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Qualifies for Public Defender.  Court discharges Attorney Sutton on the other case and Public Defender will represent on both.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
